intro: Athamanta lateriflora, commonly known as the lateriflora athamanta, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
